alert.note: Alert for Red River (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 7:19AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central McCurtain and northern Red River Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 718 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Powderly to 7 miles southwest of Paris. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarksville, Idabel, Broken Bow, Bagwell, Manchester, Wright City, Valliant, Detroit, Deport, Millerton, Haworth, Garvin, Eagletown, Cerrogordo, Hochatown, Goodwater, Woodland, Redland, Kanawha and Glover. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for southwestern Arkansas...southeastern Oklahoma...and northeastern Texas.
